title: Quick Ways to Get Burnt Popcorn Smell Out of the Microwave & Your Home

steps.title: Wipe down the inside of your microwave with water and dish soap.
steps.content: Wipe down the inside of your microwave with water and dish soap. Cleaning your microwave gets rid of any food debris that might harbor the burnt popcorn odor. Just mix together warm water with a few drops of dish soap and dampen a cloth or sponge with the mixture. Then, scrub the turntable, door, and top, sides, and bottom of the microwave. [1] X Research source Or, steam clean the inside of the microwave to help loosen any super stuck-on debris. Just pour 1 cup (273 ml) of water in a microwave-safe bowl and heat it for 5 minutes. Then, keep the door closed for 5 minutes before wiping out the inside.

steps.title: Mix ½ cup (118 ml) of water with the juice of 1 lemon.
steps.content: Mix ½ cup (118 ml) of water with the juice of 1 lemon. Pour ½ cup (118 ml) of water into a microwave-safe bowl. Then, cut 1 lemon in half and squeeze the juice from each half into the bowl. Simply drop the lemon halves into the bowl after squeezing for an extra citrusy boost. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Microwave the lemon water for 3 minutes, then let it sit for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Microwave the lemon water for 3 minutes, then let it sit for 10 minutes. Put the bowl of lemon juice and water in the microwave and heat it for 3 minutes. Then, keep the microwave door closed and let the bowl sit inside for 5 to 10 minutes. This produces a citrusy steam that neutralizes the burnt popcorn smell and makes any leftover debris easier to clean. [3] X Research source If the popcorn smell is really bad, leave the lemon water in the microwave for several hours or overnight.

steps.title: Wipe the inside of the microwave with a cloth or sponge.
steps.content: Wipe the inside of the microwave with a cloth or sponge. Open the microwave and use an oven mitt to carefully remove the bowl of lemon water. Then, take a damp sponge or cloth the scrub off any debris on the sides, bottom, top, and door of the microwave. [4] X Research source If your microwave has a turning tray, take it out and then wipe it down. Dip a scrub brush in the lemon water to clean off any stubborn stains and food debris.

steps.title: Dry the inside of the microwave with a dry cloth.
steps.content: Dry the inside of the microwave with a dry cloth. Wipe the turntable, door, and inside of the microwave with a clean, dry cloth to remove any excess moisture. Your microwave now has a refreshing, lemony scent instead of a burnt popcorn odor! [5] X Research source If you’re still smelling burnt popcorn, follow 1 of the alternative methods below to get rid of the smell once and for all.

steps.title: Mix 2 tbsp (30 ml) of vinegar with 1 cup (273 ml) of water in a bowl.
steps.content: Mix 2 tbsp (30 ml) of vinegar with 1 cup (273 ml) of water in a bowl. Vinegar is a powerful cleaning agent that also neutralizes smelly odors like burnt popcorn. Just add 2 tbsp (30 ml) of white vinegar and 1 cup (273 ml) of water to a ceramic or glass bowl. [6] X Research source While vinegar absorbs unpleasant smells, it can leave behind a scent of its own. Don’t worry though, this odor dissipates after a couple of days.

steps.title: Heat the vinegar for 5 minutes and then let it sit for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Heat the vinegar for 5 minutes and then let it sit for 10 minutes. Place the bowl of vinegar water in the microwave and heat it for 5 minutes. Then, keep it in the microwave for about 5 to 10 minutes so the steam has time to absorb the burnt popcorn smells. [7] X Research source Leave the vinegar water in the microwave for several hours or even overnight if the burnt odor is very strong.

steps.title: Clean the microwave with the vinegar solution.
steps.content: Clean the microwave with the vinegar solution. Use an oven mitt to take the bowl of vinegar out of the microwave, as it might be hot. Then, carefully dip a sponge or cloth in the solution and use it to wipe down the turning tray and inside of the microwave. This cleans off any food debris and helps get rid of any lingering smells. [8] X Research source For stubborn, stuck-on stains, use a scrub brush. Use a clean, dry cloth to wipe the inside of the microwave when you’re done cleaning.

steps.title: Place an open box of baking soda in the microwave overnight.
steps.content: Place an open box of baking soda in the microwave overnight. Baking soda is a natural deodorizer that absorbs unpleasant popcorn odors. Simply set an open box of baking soda in your microwave or pour 1 cup (272 g) of baking soda into a bowl. Then, close the microwave door and leave the baking soda inside for at least 8 hours or overnight. [9] X Research source Alternatively, use activated charcoal in place of baking soda. Charcoal also absorbs strong odors like burnt popcorn.

steps.title: Microwave baking soda and water for 3 minutes as an alternative.
steps.content: Microwave baking soda and water for 3 minutes as an alternative. If you don’t want to wait overnight, mix 2 tablespoons (34 g) of baking soda with 1 cup (273 ml) of water in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the solution for 3 minutes and then let it steam inside the microwave for 10 minutes to 1 hour. [10] X Research source Use a sponge or cloth to wipe out any food or stains after steaming the microwave.

steps.title: Leave coffee grounds in the microwave overnight.
steps.content: Leave coffee grounds in the microwave overnight. Coffee is a super effective odor absorber that also leaves your microwave with a pleasant aroma. Just scoop 1 cup (82 g) of coffee into a bowl and place it in your microwave. Shut the microwave and leave the coffee grounds inside for 8 hours or overnight. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Heat coffee and water for 3 minutes as an alternative.
steps.content: Heat coffee and water for 3 minutes as an alternative. Steaming your microwave with coffee is another easy way to get rid of the burnt popcorn smell. Simply pour 2 tablespoons (10 g) of ground coffee and ½ cup (118 ml) of water into a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave the coffee for 3 minutes and then leave it inside to steam for at least 10 minutes to 1 hour. [12] X Research source Wipe down the inside of the microwave with a sponge or cloth to remove any leftover food or stains.

steps.title: Heat vanilla extract and water in the microwave for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Heat vanilla extract and water in the microwave for 5 minutes. Vanilla extract has a strong, sweet scent that can overpower the burnt smell of popcorn. Simply pour 4 teaspoons (20 ml) of vanilla extract and 2 cups (473 ml) of water into a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave the vanilla for 5 minutes and then let it stand inside for 30 minutes. [13] X Research source If you prefer the fresh scent of berries, scoop a handful into a microwave-safe dish and heat it for 1 to 2 minutes. Then, let it sit for 15 to 30 minutes.

steps.title: Leave a bowl of cloves in your microwave overnight.
steps.content: Leave a bowl of cloves in your microwave overnight. Leave your microwave smelling rich and spicy by pouring ¼ cup (117 g) of ground cloves into a bowl. Set the bowl in your microwave and keep it in there for at least 8 hours or overnight. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Cook other things in the microwave.
steps.content: Cook other things in the microwave. Strong-smelling foods can mask and cancel out the unpleasant smell of burnt popcorn in your microwave. Just heat up foods you like the smell of, like cheese pizza, bacon, soup, and sugary-sweet pastries like cinnamon rolls.

steps.title: Open your windows and turn on any fans.
steps.content: Open your windows and turn on any fans. If the burnt popcorn smell is lingering in your kitchen, living room, or other parts of your home, simply air out the areas. Open any windows or doors in the rooms to get rid of the smell and let fresh air inside. Then, turn on any exhaust and ceiling fans to help the clean air circulate through your house. [15] X Research source Dispose of the burnt bag of popcorn if you haven’t already. Seal the popcorn in a plastic bag and then throw it in your trash can outside.

steps.title: Place lemons, baking soda, coffee, or vinegar around your home.
steps.content: Place lemons, baking soda, coffee, or vinegar around your home. Lemons, baking soda, coffee, and vinegar all absorb the burnt popcorn smell in your microwave, so they can do the same in your house. Just squeeze lemon juice into a couple of bowls or pour in baking soda, coffee, or vinegar. Then, place the bowls around your kitchen and any other affected rooms in your house. [16] X Research source Or, add lemon juice or vinegar to a spray bottle and spray it on your counters or into the air to help soak up the smell. Alternatively, simmer a pot of water and slices of citrus on your stove. Or, simply brew a pot of coffee.

steps.title: Heat 2 tsp (10 ml) of vanilla in the oven for 1 hour.
steps.content: Heat 2 tsp (10 ml) of vanilla in the oven for 1 hour. If you love the smell of vanilla, use it to overpower the pungent popcorn odor. Simply heat your oven to 300° F (149° C) and pour 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of vanilla extract into a heat-safe dish, like a coffee cup. Then, set the vanilla in the oven for 1 hour to let the fragrant scent fill your home. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Burn candles or incense, or plug in a diffuser.
steps.content: Burn candles or incense, or plug in a diffuser. Letting your favorite scents waft through the air is one of the easiest ways to get rid of the burnt popcorn odor in your home. Just burn a candle or some incense in your kitchen or wherever you smell the popcorn. If you have a diffuser, simply drop in your favorite essential oils and turn it on to get rid of the unpleasant scent. Do not leave your candle or incense unattended. Always blow out the flame whenever you leave the room, leave the house, or are going to sleep.
